Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... It's irritating to have to meet all these new people, huh?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... It's irritating to have to meet all these new people, huh?

Entries.DialogueText: Name's George, by the way. Now buzz off... Hmmph.
Entries.DisplayPattern: 's George, by the way. Now buzz off... Hmmph.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... *sip*... ahhh... Tastes just like Mama's tuna casserole! Delicious!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... *sip*... ahhh... Tastes just like Mama's tuna casserole! Delicious!

Entries.DialogueText: What's this?
Entries.DisplayPattern: What's this?

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... so you push this button first? What's this button do? Hmmph... *grumble*
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... so you push this button first? What's this button do? Hmmph... *grumble*

Entries.DialogueText: Hehe! Well, how about that! It's a new channel! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hehe! Well, how about that! It's a new channel!

Entries.DialogueText: Here, take this. It's a stone I found when I was a coal miner back in the day. Funny thing, it's glowed blue and stayed cold for over forty years. Like magic!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here, take this. It's a stone I found when I was a coal miner back in the day. Funny thing, it's glowed blue and stayed cold for over forty years. Like magic!

Entries.DialogueText: There, there, honey... Don't you worry.%noturn
Entries.DisplayPattern: There, there, honey... Don't you worry.

Entries.DialogueText: Even if it is poisonous, I breathed in more noxious gas in one minute back in the ol' coal mines... And I'm still kickin'!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Even if it is poisonous, I breathed in more noxious gas in one minute back in the ol' coal mines... And I'm still kickin'!

Entries.DialogueText: Looks like the young folks will have to do some extra weeding after this one...Heheh... {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Looks like the young folks will have to do some extra weeding after this one...Heheh...

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks for replacing that beat up old trailer... the new house is much nicer to look at.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks for replacing that beat up old trailer... the new house is much nicer to look at.

Entries.DialogueText: You know, I'll bet it increases the value of our property too!
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, I'll bet it increases the value of our property too!

Entries.DialogueText: Welp... that new house blocks my view of the river a little... but it sure looks nicer than that old tin can Pam was livin' in.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Welp... that new house blocks my view of the river a little... but it sure looks nicer than that old tin can Pam was livin' in.

Entries.DialogueText: You wanna see a movie with an old geezer like me? ...Well... okay. I'll meet you there.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You wanna see a movie with an old geezer like me? ...Well... okay. I'll meet you there.

Entries.DialogueText: I dunno what you did, but those raccoons haven't been back since last week!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I dunno what you did, but those raccoons haven't been back since last week!

Entries.DialogueText: I may seem out of touch, but when you've been around for as long as I have, you learn a thing or two about the ways of life. It's called 'wisdom'.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I may seem out of touch, but when you've been around for as long as I have, you learn a thing or two about the ways of life. It's called 'wisdom'.

Entries.DialogueText: Young people don't understand the big picture. How could they?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Young people don't understand the big picture. How could they?

Entries.DialogueText: ...Hmmph.
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...Hmmph.

Entries.DialogueText: I'd like to become a great-grandpa before I croak. Think you can make that happen?
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'd like to become a great-grandpa before I croak. Think you can make that happen?

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... took the easy way out, huh?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... took the easy way out, huh?

Entries.DialogueText: People these days treat marriage like a television set... If you get bored, just change the channel! Back in my day... *grumble*
Entries.DisplayPattern: People these days treat marriage like a television set... If you get bored, just change the channel! Back in my day... *grumble*

Entries.DialogueText: So... the old Community Center is gone, huh? Whatever happened to small-town values? It's a shame how times have changed...
Entries.DisplayPattern: So... the old Community Center is gone, huh? Whatever happened to small-town values? It's a shame how s have changed...

Entries.DialogueText: I'm not much of a talker. Especially not to strangers, if you don't mind me saying.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm not much of a talker. Especially not to strangers, if you don't mind me saying.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... Looks like another gloomy day. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... Looks like another gloomy day.

Entries.DialogueText: Alex is my grandson. Have I told you that already?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Alex is my grandson. Have I told you that already?

Entries.DialogueText: Huh? Speak up.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Huh? Speak up.

Entries.DialogueText: How can two men get married? It's unnatural... Hmmph. I guess I'm just "old fashioned"...
Entries.DisplayPattern: How can two men get married? It's unnatural... Hmmph. I guess I'm just "old fashioned"...

Entries.DialogueText: You're part of the family, now. I'm glad that my grandson found such a nice wife.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're part of the family, now. I'm glad that my grandson found such a nice wife.

Entries.DialogueText: I'll admit, I thought it was... strange... for two men to be together. But you're such a nice young man, and I know you two are in love... I've changed my mind.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll admit, I thought it was... strange... for two men to be together. But you're such a nice young man, and I know you two are in love... I've changed my mind.

Entries.DialogueText: You're part of the family, now... and I couldn't be more proud.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You're part of the family, now... and I couldn't be more proud.

Entries.DialogueText: I can't talk right now, young man.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I can't talk right now, young man.

Entries.DialogueText: I can't talk right now, miss.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I can't talk right now, miss.

Entries.DialogueText: My favorite program is on.
Entries.DisplayPattern: My program is on.

Entries.DialogueText: So you're a farmer, huh? At least it's honest work.
Entries.DisplayPattern: So you're a er, huh? At least it's honest work.

Entries.DialogueText: The weekend is no different than any other time, for me.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The weekend is no different than any other , for me.

Entries.DialogueText: That's how it is when you're retired.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That's how it is when you're retired.

Entries.DialogueText: Aren't you cold? They don't make sweaters like they used to.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Aren't you cold? They don't make sweaters like they used to.

Entries.DialogueText: *Sigh*
Entries.DisplayPattern: *Sigh*

Entries.DialogueText: I'm surprised you want to be friends with an old-timer like me.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm surprised you want to be friends with an old-r like me.

Entries.DialogueText: Hello, {Farmer_Name}. Wanna watch the TV with me?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hello, . Wanna watch the TV with me?

Entries.DialogueText: My grand-pap was a farmer. It's a respectable profession.
Entries.DisplayPattern: My grand-pap was a er. It's a respectable profession.

Entries.DialogueText: If I wasn't so darned old I'd come to your farm and show you a thing or two...
Entries.DisplayPattern: If I wasn't so darned old I'd come to your and show you a thing or two...

Entries.DialogueText: I wish my legs worked so I could play catch with Alex. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I wish my legs worked so I could play catch with Alex.

Entries.DialogueText: That'll never happen. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: That'll never happen.

Entries.DialogueText: I've been thinking...Maybe I've been a little bit of a grouch. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been thinking...Maybe I've been a little bit of a grouch.

Entries.DialogueText: I used to think no one cared about us old folks.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I used to think no one cared about us old folks.

Entries.DialogueText: You know, I really have been a grumpy old man to everyone. But now I feel like I'm softening up like an old ripe fruit. Hehe! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, I really have been a grumpy old man to everyone. But now I feel like I'm softening up like an old ripe fruit. Hehe!

Entries.DialogueText: Take care, son.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Take care, son.

Entries.DialogueText: Take care, hun.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Take care, hun.

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}! Let me turn off this darned television and we can have a little chat. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: ! Let me turn off this darned television and we can have a little chat.

Entries.DialogueText: So what are the young people doing these days?
Entries.DisplayPattern: So what are the young people doing these days?

Entries.DialogueText: You know, I shouldn't get too depressed about my legs.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You know, I shouldn't get too depressed about my legs.

Entries.DialogueText: I should just be happy that I'm alive. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I should just be happy that I'm alive.

Entries.DialogueText: When you get as old as me it's a lot harder to adjust to new things.
Entries.DisplayPattern: When you get as old as me it's a lot harder to ust to new things.

Entries.DialogueText: One day you'll know what I mean.
Entries.DisplayPattern: One day you'll know what I mean.

Entries.DialogueText: Go on, enjoy yourself while you're still young.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Go on, enjoy yourself while you're still young.

Entries.DialogueText: Ohh... It's so cold.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ohh... It's so cold.

Entries.DialogueText: When you're young the cold doesn't bite as hard.
Entries.DisplayPattern: When you're young the cold doesn't bite as hard.

Entries.DialogueText: You don't like it, huh? Bah! Kids these days... no appreciation for anything. That was expensive, and I'm not made of money, you know!
Entries.DisplayPattern: You don't like it, huh? Bah! Kids these days... no appreciation for anything. That was expensive, and I'm not made of money, you know!

Entries.DialogueText: It's awful cold, isn't it? What a rotten day.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's awful cold, isn't it? What a rotten day.

Entries.DialogueText: *Sigh*... How am I going to reach that letter in the back? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *Sigh*... How am I going to reach that letter in the back?

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph. I could've done it myself! And I can certainly move around on my own! {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph. I could've done it myself! And I can certainly move around on my own!

Entries.DialogueText: How feeble do you think I am?
Entries.DisplayPattern: How feeble do you think I am?

Entries.DialogueText: *sigh*...No, no... I'm sorry, miss. I shouldn't have gotten so angry. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sigh*...No, no... I'm sorry, miss. I shouldn't have gotten so angry.

Entries.DialogueText: It was actually very kind of you to help me out.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It was actually very kind of you to help me out.

Entries.DialogueText: The good ol' days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The good ol' days.

Entries.DialogueText: I've lived here too long to see this town go to ruin.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've lived here too long to see this town go to ruin.

Entries.DialogueText: You can count me in! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You can count me in!

Entries.DialogueText: Grr... sounds like those raccoons are back again. Filthy varmints...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Grr... sounds like those raccoons are back again. Filthy varmints...

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you turned up at the right moment, son.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, you turned up at the right moment, son.

Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you turned up at the right moment, miss.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah, you turned up at the right moment, miss.

Entries.DialogueText: Could you do an old man a favor? Could you go around the corner and scare off those raccoons for me? They've been causin' a real mess.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Could you do an old man a favor? Could you go around the corner and scare off those raccoons for me? They've been causin' a real mess.

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks. Make sure you give 'em a good scare so they never come back.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks. Make sure you give 'em a good scare so they never come back.

Entries.DialogueText: What's the money for, anyway? You buyin' a new purse?
Entries.DisplayPattern: What's the money for, anyway? You buyin' a new purse?

Entries.DialogueText: Nnnnggghh....I just can't reach it! {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Nnnnggghh....I just can't reach it!

Entries.DialogueText: If only I could get up from this infernal chair... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: If only I could get up from this infernal chair...

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks, young man.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks, young man.

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks, miss.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks, miss.

Entries.DialogueText: *sigh*...It happened 30 years ago. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *sigh*...It happened 30 years ago.

Entries.DialogueText: I was working in the coal mines. We were near the end of our shift, but there was one last seam that needed to be broken up.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I was working in the coal mines. We were near the end of our shift, but there was one last seam that needed to be broken up.

Entries.DialogueText: I went in there aiming to set off a stick of dynamite, but my foot slipped into a crack and I dropped it. The dynamite exploded on impact.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I went in there aiming to set off a stick of dynamite, but my foot slipped into a crack and I dropped it. The dynamite exploded on impact.

Entries.DialogueText: The next thing I remember, I was laying in the hospital... and they told me I'd never walk again.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The next thing I remember, I was laying in the hospital... and they told me I'd never walk again.

Entries.DialogueText: So there you have it. You probably figured I was just too old to walk.
Entries.DisplayPattern: So there you have it. You probably figured I was just too old to walk.

Entries.DialogueText: Well I'll have you know that I'd be spryer than a spring chicken if I hadn't been in that accident!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well I'll have you know that I'd be spryer than a spring chicken if I hadn't been in that accident!

Entries.DialogueText: You've been very nice to me, young man. I appreciate that.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You've been very nice to me, young man. I appreciate that.

Entries.DialogueText: You've been really nice to me, miss. I appreciate it.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You've been really nice to me, miss. I appreciate it.

Entries.DialogueText: When you're old, you start to forget that anyone cares about you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: When you're old, you start to forget that anyone cares about you.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... I know what's best for me. Who do you think you are, telling me how to live my life?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... I know what's best for me. Who do you think you are, telling me how to live my life?

Entries.DialogueText: Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young man.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young man.

Entries.DialogueText: Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young lady.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young lady.

Entries.DialogueText: Fine. I'll do what you say, doctor.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Fine. I'll do what you say, doctor.

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}? What's the meaning of all this...
Entries.DisplayPattern: ? What's the meaning of all this...

Entries.DialogueText: Is this some kind of prank?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Is this some kind of prank?

Entries.DialogueText: Leek... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Leek...

Entries.DialogueText: My favorite... Just like Mama used to make, so many years ago...
Entries.DisplayPattern: My ... Just like Mama used to make, so many years ago...

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph. Well...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph. Well...

Entries.DialogueText: Well... That... Hmmph.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well... That... Hmmph.

Entries.DialogueText: I guess maybe I'm not as forgotten and ignored as I thought... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I guess maybe I'm not as forgotten and ignored as I thought...

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks, son. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks, son.

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks, hun. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks, hun.

Entries.DialogueText: You made an old man's day. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You made an old man's day.

Entries.DialogueText: Hah! She thought she could fool me!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hah! She thought she could fool me!

Entries.DialogueText: She thought she could fool me... into thinking I'm anything more than an inconvenience. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: She thought she could fool me... into thinking I'm anything more than an inconvenience.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, I know better...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, I know better...

Entries.DialogueText: Now, scram! {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now, scram!

Entries.DialogueText: Hah! You're a prankster, then?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hah! You're a prankster, then?

Entries.DialogueText: Hahah... You know, I was a bit of a prankster back in the day, too. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hahah... You know, I was a bit of a prankster back in the day, too.

Entries.DialogueText: Well, at least you gave me a laugh. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, at least you gave me a laugh.

Entries.DialogueText: What, you think I'm going to open them?
Entries.DisplayPattern: What, you think I'm going to open them?

Entries.DialogueText: Hah! Not a chance. You think I'd fall for the old 'exploding present' gag?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hah! Not a chance. You think I'd fall for the old 'exploding present' gag?

Entries.DialogueText: These are going straight into the trash!
Entries.DisplayPattern: These are going straight into the trash!

Entries.DialogueText: Score!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Score!

Entries.DialogueText: Atta boy!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Atta boy!

Entries.DialogueText: You did good, son. I could watch this at home, but coming here makes me feel young again! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You did good, son. I could watch this at home, but coming here makes me feel young again!

Entries.DialogueText: Ha! Good stuff!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ha! Good stuff!

Entries.DialogueText: Get him!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Get him!

Entries.DialogueText: Morris and his JojaMart cronies were never heard from again.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Morris and his JojaMart cronies were never heard from again.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... smoked turkey haunch? I guess this festival isn't all bad. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... smoked turkey haunch? I guess this festival isn't all bad.

Entries.DialogueText: George is on the verge of falling asleep.
Entries.DisplayPattern: George is on the verge of falling asleep.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmm... smoked turkey haunch? I guess this festival isn't all bad. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmm... smoked turkey haunch? I guess this festival isn't all bad.

Entries.DialogueText: If I wasn't in this blasted chair, I'd be running circles around everyone in that maze! {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: If I wasn't in this blasted chair, I'd be running circles around everyone in that maze!

Entries.DialogueText: What's everyone so happy about? Hmmph...
Entries.DisplayPattern: What's everyone so happy about? Hmmph...

Entries.DialogueText: Eggs... why eggs?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Eggs... why eggs?

Entries.DialogueText: Evelyn made eggs and leeks for breakfast, so I'm in a good mood. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Evelyn made eggs and leeks for breakfast, so I'm in a good mood.

Entries.DialogueText: Flowers? I can hardly see them.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Flowers? I can hardly see them.

Entries.DialogueText: It's too bright out here!
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's too bright out here!

Entries.DialogueText: Flowers? More like bumblebee magnets. Hmph. Can't smell much anyway. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Flowers? More like bumblebee magnets. Hmph. Can't smell much anyway.

Entries.DialogueText: That music! It's too loud.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That music! It's too loud.

Entries.DialogueText: Can't I have a little peace and quiet to enjoy the ocean?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Can't I have a little peace and quiet to enjoy the ocean?

Entries.DialogueText: Leek and garlic mashed potatoes? Hehe... honey, I think I've died and gone to heaven!%noturn {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Leek and garlic mashed potatoes? Hehe... honey, I think I've died and gone to heaven!

Entries.DialogueText: What, why are you looking at me like that? You think I'm too old to enjoy something like this?
Entries.DisplayPattern: What, why are you looking at me like that? You think I'm too old to enjoy something like this?

Entries.DialogueText: Back in the old days, we used to scoop 'em up and put 'em in jars... {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Back in the old days, we used to scoop 'em up and put 'em in jars...

Entries.DialogueText: Times have changed... Times have changed...
Entries.DisplayPattern: s have changed... s have changed...

Entries.DialogueText: A feast for some stupid star? Humbug!
Entries.DisplayPattern: A feast for some stupid star? Humbug!

Entries.DialogueText: I already spend all day with the family, anyway. Why do we need a big hubbub out in the cold? {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I already spend all day with the family, anyway. Why do we need a big hubbub out in the cold?

Entries.DialogueText: Hmmph... Wife dragged me out into the cold for this?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmmph... Wife dragged me out into the cold for this?

Entries.DialogueText: When you get old and bald like me, you need a good, warm hat.
Entries.DisplayPattern: When you get old and bald like me, you need a good, warm hat.

Entries.DialogueText: This is my favorite thing! Thank you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: This is my thing! Thank you.

Entries.DialogueText: Thanks.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thanks.

Entries.DialogueText: That's a terrible gift.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That's a terrible gift.

Entries.DialogueText: This is probably the worst gift I've ever seen. Thanks a lot.
Entries.DisplayPattern: This is probably the worst gift I've ever seen. Thanks a lot.

Entries.DialogueText: A gift? Hmm...
Entries.DisplayPattern: A gift? Hmm...

Entries.DialogueText: Do you want something in return?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Do you want something in return?

Entries.DialogueText: The newspaper gave this one '5 stars', so I'm willing to give it a go.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The newspaper gave this one '5 stars', so I'm willing to give it a go.

Entries.DialogueText: Heh! That was actually pretty good! Thanks for inviting me.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Heh! That was actually pretty good! Thanks for inviting me.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmph... Theaters aren't like they used to be... But the picture might be good enough.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmph... Theaters aren't like they used to be... But the picture might be good enough.

Entries.DialogueText: Heh. Compared to most movies these days, it wasn't bad. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Heh. Compared to most movies these days, it wasn't bad.

Entries.DialogueText: Hmph... I'll take a nap during this one.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hmph... I'll take a nap during this one.

Entries.DialogueText: Shameful! The trash they pass for 'movies' these days...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Shameful! The trash they pass for 'movies' these days...

Entries.DialogueText: What is she mumbling about? I'm here for the spicy food tent!
Entries.DisplayPattern: What is she mumbling about? I'm here for the spicy food tent!

Entries.DialogueText: I've got everything worth selling.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've got everything worth selling.
